articles.content:
Croatian President on Relations with DPRK 
    Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- Croatia has a good prospect of bilateral cooperation with the DPRK, though geographically far away from each other. 
 Croatian President Stipe Mesic said this when receiving credentials from the DPRK ambassador e. p. to Croatia on Nov. 22. 
 The president said Croatia hopes that multi-faceted cooperation between the two countries would be strengthened.    
 Referring to the situation on the Korean Peninsula, he sent hearty regards to leader Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Resignation of Director of Police Office Demanded in S. Korea
Staff Members of Cuban Embassy Visit Museum of Gifts of Ministry of People's Armed Forces
articles.content:
Resignation of Director of Police Office Demanded in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- The "All-People Measure Committee for the Fundamental Recovery of Agriculture and Condemnation of the Murder of Farmer Jon Yong Chol" had a press conference in front of the building of the Police Office in Seoul on Nov. 28 to denounce the police for its use of force, according to the south Korean MBC. 
 The organization expressed resentment at the police authorities who, showing photos of the scene of the farmers' demonstration, claimed that Jon's death was not attributable to the police brutal suppression as the dress of the dead was clean and no wound could be found on him, a far-fetched excuse to dodge the responsibility.    
 Accusing the police of working hard to cover up and falsify the truth behind his death caused by the brutal crackdown, the organization demanded the director of the police office to own the responsibility for the murder and immediately resign.

articles.title: Romanian Charge d'Affaires Hosts Reception
articles.content:
Staff Members of Cuban Embassy Visit Museum of Gifts of Ministry of People's Armed Forces 
    Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- Staff members of the Cuban embassy here visited the Museum of Gifts of the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces on Dec. 1 on the occasion of the 49th anniversary of the Cuban revolutionary armed forces.
 They attentively looked round the gifts associated with the boundless reverence and infinite laudation of the servicepersons of the Korean People's Army for President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il who led the Workers' Party of Korea, the army and the people along the road of victory with their unique Songun revolutionary leadership to demonstrate the dignity and might of Juche Korea.    
 Giraldo Abreu Morales, military attache of the Cuban embassy, made an entry in the visitor's book after visiting. He wrote that he extends militant greetings to the KPA which is in one trench of the struggle against the U.S. imperialists, common enemy, and wishes the Korean people greater success in their struggle to build a great prosperous powerful socialist nation and achieve independent and peaceful reunification of the country.

Romanian Charge d'Affaires Hosts Reception 
    Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- The Romanian charge d' affaires ad interim in Pyongyang hosted a reception at the Taedonggang Club for the Diplomatic Corps Thursday evening on the occasion of the national day of Romania.
 Present on invitation were Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Kim Yong Jae, vice-minister of Foreign Trade, officials concerned, diplomatic envoys of different countries and representatives of international organizations in Pyongyang.    
 On hand were staff members of the Romanian embassy.
 Speeches were made.
